intro: Romulea cruciata var. intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant belonging to the Iridaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant produces striking, star-shaped flowers in shades of white to pale purple, typically blooming in late summer. It is a perennial herb with a short, underground stem and narrow, grass-like leaves. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens with well-drained soil and full sun.
